001/** This controller provides functionality for the x report
002 * @author Sarah Higdon
003 */
004
005package src.controller;
006
007import javafx.event.ActionEvent;
008import javafx.fxml.FXML;
009import javafx.fxml.Initializable;
010import javafx.scene.control.TableColumn;
011import javafx.scene.control.TableRow;
012import javafx.scene.control.TableView;
013import javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent;
014import javafx.beans.property.SimpleIntegerProperty;
015import javafx.beans.property.SimpleStringProperty;
016
017import java.net.URL;
018import java.sql.Connection;
019import java.sql.PreparedStatement;
020import java.sql.ResultSet;
021import java.time.LocalDate;
022import java.util.ArrayList;
023import java.util.HashMap;
024import java.util.List;
025import java.util.Map;
026import java.util.ResourceBundle;
027
028import src.database.dbConnect;
029
030import static src.controller.useful_functions.switch_scene;
031import src.controller.useful_functions;
032
033public class x_report_controller implements Initializable {
034
035    //---------- FXML refs (TableView-only UI) ----------
036    @FXML private TableView<hour_row> x_report_table;
037    @FXML private TableColumn<hour_row, String>  col_hour;
038    @FXML private TableColumn<hour_row, Integer> col_orders;
039    @FXML private TableColumn<hour_row, Integer> col_items;
040    @FXML private TableColumn<hour_row, String>  col_sales;
041
042    //---------- rows from database ----------
043    /**
044     * Class representing a single hour’s metrics from the database.
045     */
046    private static class hour_metrics {
047        int hour;     //0 to 23
048        int orders;
049        int items;
050        double sales;
051    }
052
053    //---------- row wrapper for the FXML TableView----------
054    private static class hour_row {
055        final SimpleStringProperty  hour   = new SimpleStringProperty();
056        final SimpleIntegerProperty orders = new SimpleIntegerProperty();
057        final SimpleIntegerProperty items  = new SimpleIntegerProperty();
058        final SimpleStringProperty  sales  = new SimpleStringProperty();
059        final boolean is_total;
060
061        /**
062         * Constructor for a normal hour row.
063         * @param m - Metrics for this hour
064         */
065        hour_row(hour_metrics m) { this(m, false); }
066        /**
067         * Constructor for an hour row with a total flag.
068         * @param m - Metrics for this hour or totals
069         * @param is_total - Whether this row is the totals row
070         */
071        hour_row(hour_metrics m, boolean is_total) {
072            this.is_total = is_total;
073            hour.set(is_total ? "Total" : String.format("%02d:00", m.hour));
074            orders.set(m.orders);
075            items.set(m.items);
076            sales.set(money(m.sales));
077        }
078    }
079    /**
080     * Initializes the x report controller by binding columns, styling, disabling sorting,
081     * adding a special style for the totals row, and loading today’s data.
082     * @param url - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object
083     * @param rb - The resources used to localize the root object
084     */
085    @Override
086    public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle rb) {
087        // Bind columns to properties
088        col_hour.setCellValueFactory(cd -> cd.getValue().hour);
089        col_orders.setCellValueFactory(cd -> cd.getValue().orders.asObject()); 
090        col_items.setCellValueFactory(cd -> cd.getValue().items.asObject()); 
091        col_sales.setCellValueFactory(cd -> cd.getValue().sales);
092
093        //some manual java styling
094        col_hour.setStyle("-fx-alignment: CENTER-LEFT;");
095        col_orders.setStyle("-fx-alignment: CENTER-RIGHT;");
096        col_items.setStyle("-fx-alignment: CENTER-RIGHT;");
097        col_sales.setStyle("-fx-alignment: CENTER-RIGHT;");
098
099        // Keep totals last: disable sorting
100        col_hour.setSortable(false);
101        col_orders.setSortable(false);
102        col_items.setSortable(false);
103        col_sales.setSortable(false);
104
105        // style the last row separately
106        x_report_table.setRowFactory(tv -> new TableRow<hour_row>() {
107            @Override
108            protected void updateItem(hour_row item, boolean empty) {
109                super.updateItem(item, empty);
110                getStyleClass().remove("x-total-row");
111                if (!empty && item != null && item.is_total) {
112                    getStyleClass().add("x-total-row");
113                    setMouseTransparent(true);
114                    setFocusTraversable(false);
115                }
116            }
117        });
118
119        // Last column flexes to fill
120        x_report_table.setColumnResizePolicy(
121            TableView.CONSTRAINED_RESIZE_POLICY_FLEX_LAST_COLUMN
122        );
123
124        refresh_table(); //loads the current day
125    }
126
127    // ---------- Navigation (wired-in FXML) ----------
128    /**
129     * This function handles the back click action to return to the sales page.
130     * @param event - Trigger for the function to be called
131     */
132    @FXML
133    private void handle_back_click(ActionEvent event) {
134        switch_scene("GUI/sales_page.fxml", event);
135    }
136
137    /**
138     * This function handles the x report click action to refresh the table.
139     * @param event - Trigger for the function to be called
140     */
141    @FXML
142    private void handle_x_report_click(ActionEvent event) {
143        refresh_table(); //just refreshes the table
144    }
145
146    /**
147     * This function handles the z report click action to navigate to the z report page.
148     * @param event - Trigger for the function to be called
149     */
150    @FXML
151    private void handle_z_report_click(ActionEvent event) {
152        switch_scene("GUI/z_report.fxml", event);
153    }
154
155    /**
156     * This function handles the menu click action to navigate to the menu items page.
157     * @param event - Trigger for the function to be called
158     */
159    @FXML
160    private void handle_menu_click(MouseEvent event) {
161        switch_scene("GUI/menu_items_page.fxml", event);
162    }
163
164    /**
165     * This function handles the inventory click action to navigate to the inventory page.
166     * @param event - Trigger for the function to be called
167     */
168    @FXML
169    private void handle_inventory_click(MouseEvent event) {
170        switch_scene("GUI/inventory_page.fxml", event);
171    }
172
173    /**
174     * This function handles the sales click action to navigate to the sales page.
175     * @param event - Trigger for the function to be called
176     */
177    @FXML
178    private void handle_sales_click(MouseEvent event) {
179        switch_scene("GUI/sales_page.fxml", event);
180    }
181
182    /**
183     * This function handles the run click action to generate the x report for today.
184     * It clears the zero report flag and refreshes the table.
185     * @param event - Trigger for the function to be called
186     */
187    @FXML
188    private void handle_run_click(ActionEvent event) {
189        // When Run is pressed, generate report
190        useful_functions.zero_x_report = false;
191        refresh_table();
192    }
193
194    //---------- data refresh ----------
195    /**
196     * This function rebuilds the table for all 24 hours and appends a totals row.
197     * It shows a zeroed report if the zero flag was set.
198     */
199    private void refresh_table() {
200        List<hour_metrics> metrics;
201
202        if (useful_functions.zero_x_report) {
203            // Show zeros this one time, then clear the flag so it won't persist
204            metrics = new ArrayList<>();
205            useful_functions.zero_x_report = false;
206        } else {
207            metrics = fetch_hourly_metrics(LocalDate.now());
208        }
209
210        //make sure all 24 hours appear
211        Map<Integer, hour_metrics> by_hour = new HashMap<>();
212        for (hour_metrics m : metrics) by_hour.put(m.hour, m);
213
214        var data = javafx.collections.FXCollections.<hour_row>observableArrayList();
215
216        for (int h = 0; h < 24; h++) {
217            hour_metrics m = by_hour.getOrDefault(h, zero_row(h));
218            data.add(new hour_row(m));
219        }
220
221        // last row
222        int total_orders = metrics.stream().mapToInt(m -> m.orders).sum();
223        int total_items  = metrics.stream().mapToInt(m -> m.items).sum();
224        double total_sales = metrics.stream().mapToDouble(m -> m.sales).sum();
225
226        hour_metrics totals = new hour_metrics();
227        totals.orders = total_orders;
228        totals.items  = total_items;
229        totals.sales  = total_sales;
230
231        data.add(new hour_row(totals, true)); // last row = totals
232
233        x_report_table.setItems(data);
234    }
235
236    //---------- database access ----------
237    /**
238     * This function fetches hourly order, item, and sales totals for the given date.
239     * The SQL groups by hour and returns aggregates.
240     * @param date - The date to report on
241     * @return A list of hourly metrics; may be empty
242     */
243    private List<hour_metrics> fetch_hourly_metrics(LocalDate date) {
244        List<hour_metrics> out = new ArrayList<>();
245
246        final String sql = """
247            SELECT
248            EXTRACT(HOUR FROM o.ordertime)::int AS hr,
249            COUNT(DISTINCT o.orderid) AS orders_count,
250            COALESCE(SUM(items_per_order.item_count), 0) AS items_count,
251            COALESCE(SUM(o.ordertotal), 0) AS sales_total
252            FROM orders o
253            LEFT JOIN (
254            SELECT orderid, COUNT(productid) AS item_count
255            FROM orderitems
256            GROUP BY orderid
257            ) AS items_per_order
258            ON items_per_order.orderid = o.orderid
259            WHERE o.orderdate = CURRENT_DATE
260            GROUP BY hr
261            ORDER BY hr;
262        """;
263
264        try (Connection conn = dbConnect.getConnection();
265             PreparedStatement ps = conn.prepareStatement(sql);
266             ResultSet rs = ps.executeQuery()) {
267
268            while (rs.next()) {
269                hour_metrics hm = new hour_metrics();
270                hm.hour   = rs.getInt("hr");
271                hm.orders = rs.getInt("orders_count");
272                hm.items  = rs.getInt("items_count");
273                hm.sales  = rs.getDouble("sales_total");
274                out.add(hm);
275            }
276        } catch (Exception e) {
277            //suggested error handling (we shouldn't need this)
278            System.err.println("X Report error: " + e.getClass().getSimpleName() + " — " + e.getMessage());
279        }
280
281        return out;
282    }
283
284    // ---------- helper functions----------
285    /**
286     * This function formats a double value as currency.
287     * @param v - The double value to format as money
288     * @return A formatted string representing the money value
289     */
290    private static String money(double v) {
291        return String.format("$%.2f", v);
292    }
293
294    /**
295     * This function creates an empty hour metrics row for a given hour.
296     * @param hour - The hour index from 0 to 23
297     * @return A metrics object with zeros for all fields
298     */
299    private static hour_metrics zero_row(int hour) {
300        hour_metrics z = new hour_metrics();
301        z.hour = hour;
302        z.orders = 0;
303        z.items = 0;
304        z.sales = 0.0;
305        return z;
306    }
307}
